titles.title: Dawit “Psalter” / Historiographic note on the Tablets of Law and on ʾAksum / Ṣälotä nädära, ʾAsmat-prayer against a disease called nädära and against an evil eye

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 1r-161vb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 1r-124v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 125r-138r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 138r-145r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 145ra-156vb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 156vb-161vb) II) Historiographic note on the Tablets of Law and on ʾAksum (fol. 164r) III) Ṣälotä nädära, ʾAsmat-prayer against a disease called nädära and against an evil eye (fols. 165r-168v)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased from the supplication formula on fol. 146r. Gäbrä Giyorgis is mentioned in a few supplication formulas added later (s. Additio 1).

dcomments.dcomment: Text I (quires I-XXI) probably comes from the second half of the 18th cent.-first half of the 19th cent. Texts II and III (quire XXII) dates back to the second half of the 20th cent.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is composed of quires I-XXI; quire XXII, with leaves of a smaller size, is not bound to the main textblock in any way. The Ms. is worn; many fols. are stained with wax. Both boards are broken and repaired with cords. A few holes are visible on the face of the front board. The leather cover is missing. The sewing is damaged. Rubrication in Texts II and III has washed out. Some fols. are damaged by rodents. Holes and tears amended on fols. 23, 40, 114.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both boards are broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex. Quire XXI is reinforced by two short parchment guards.

inks.ink: Black, red (Text I: strong red and deep reddish brown; Texts II, III: vivid rose)

squires.squire:
፩I(8/fols. 1r-8v) – ፪II(8/fols. 9r-16v) – ፫III(8/fols. 17r-24v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – ፭V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 65r-72v) – ፲X(8/fols. 73r-80v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 81r-88v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 89r-96v) – XIII(8/fols. 97r-104v) – XIV(8/fols. 105r-112v) – XV(8/fols. 113r-120v) – XVI(8/fols. 121r-128v) – XVII(8/fols. 129r-136v) – XVIII(8/fols. 137r-144v) – ፲፱XIX(8/fols. 145r-152v) – XX(8/fols. 153r-160v) – XXI(3; s.l.: 3, stub before 1/fols. 161r-163v) – <XXII(6/fols. 164r-169v)>.
Quire XXII (loosely inserted into the Ms.) consists of two bifolios (leaves 2-3 and 4-5) which are inserted between another bifolio (leaves 1-6). Its leaves are of a small size.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 2r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 146r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts II, III: all data for fol. 165r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Text II: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/A. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

margin.info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 2r.
Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 148r.
Text II: all data for fol. 167r.

txcolumns.txcolumn: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3, II; 2 col. Texts I-4, I-5

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C; Texts I-4, I-5: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C; Text II: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/A. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Text I: second half of the 18th cent. - first half of the 19th cent. (?); Texts II, III: second half of the 20th century

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre; hand b: mediocre

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 1r-161vb; slender, round and slightly left-sloping letters; letters ደ and የ of all orders often have hairlines. Hand b: fols. 165r-168v; slender letters often featured with distinctive hairlines.

rubrications.rubrication:
Text I Nomina sacra (name of God in Text I-1; name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; title of Text I-5; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5 (a few initial words or abbreviated); some quire marks; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black) on the incipit pages of Text I-2; two lines (alternating with a black line) on the incipit page of Text 1-2; two lines on the incipit page of Text I-3; two groups of lines (alternating with black) on the incipit page of Text I-4. Texts II, III Two lines on the incipit page; a few lines on fol. 167r; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ስ፡/ስቡ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 133v-134v) Text I-4 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ፤ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 145rb-vb) እ፡/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 146va-147vb, 149vb) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 148rb-149rb) ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 150vb-152rb) ለ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 152vb) ተ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 154rb-155rb) ወ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 155vb-156rb) Text I-5 ወ፤ ሣ፤ ይ፤ ሰ፤ ቅ፤ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት The abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ወ፡/ወበ፡/ወበእ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 158ra-161rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Numerous mistakes in the numbering of the Pss.

additional.cont: Fol. 161vb: Short prayer for the donors.
additional.det: The note is written in a poor hand, in red. It is certainly later than the main text. It mentions Gäbrä Giyorgis, his father Wäldä Kidan and his mother. Similar supplication formulas appear on fols. 42r, 84v, 156vb and 145r. On fol. 145r the name of Gäbrä Giyorgis has been replaced by that of Gäbrä Ṣadǝq.
The note is written in a fine hand.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a chain of red and black dots. - Part of the written line is taken up: fols. 2v, 6v, 20v, 29r, 42v, 44v, 53v, 57r, 71v, 79r, 80r, 86v, 88v, 96r, 98v, 99v, 108r, 109v, 132r, 139v. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where omissions, written interlineally in a secondary hand, belong: fols. 90v l.20, 94v l.7, 117v l.19, 129r l.9, 135v l.8. - Omitted words and passages are written interlineally and in the margins, in secondary hands: e.g., fols. 3r, 7r, 11r, 18v, 25r, 33v, 35r, 41r, 42v, 44r, 65r, 103r, 110v, 125v, 126v, 132v, 136v, 146vb, 156vb. - Fol. 163 is a re-used leaf originating from another codex. - Notes or scribbles have been crudely erased: fols. 56v, 57r, 58r, 115v. - Scribbles, writing exercises, doodles: e.g., fols. 1r, 2r, 7rv, 17v, 19v, 22v, 36r, 45v, 57v, 58v, 66v, 73v, 74r, 83r, 99v, 113r, 137r, 151v, 152r, 162v, 163r, 169rv.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of fols. 1r, 9r, 17r, 25r, 33r, 41r, 49r, 57r, 65r, 73r, 81r, 89r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings of Text I-5 are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the upper margin, in two secondary hands, in pen: ናይ፡ ሰሉስ (in Tǝgrǝñña): fol. 146rb ረቡዕ: fol. 148ra ሐሙስ: fol. 150ra ናይ፡ ቀዳም (in Tǝgrǝñña): 154ra.
